title: Self-Sovereignty Trial
outcome: A neighborhood cuts BCI ties, triggering a tense grassroots experiment in self-governance. Its measured success and ripple effects challenge centralized control, spurring debate, hope, and unease citywide.

events.description: A residential district disconnects from all BCI-linked services, launching a local council and self-governance. Initial confusion follows as city systems reroute resources.
Community routines and conflict resolution begin adjusting as residents propose their own rules. Outsiders watch closely; city officials issue cautious warnings but do not intervene.
Unexpectedly, the pilot area’s residents report less daily stress and greater participation in decision-making. News of their experiment spreads, drawing attention and imitation attempts.
The Council holds tense meetings as more neighborhoods signal intent to disconnect from BCI, fracturing Council and Directorate unity. Leaders fear total governance breakdown.
‘Free zones’ emerge across the city. Grassroots structures multiply, citizens debate new models, and the future of centralized control hangs in the balance.
